content: bittrex will be closing and stopping operation, so make sure that your that if you have funds in Bittrex make sure to transfer it to your wallet or on an exchange of your choice but it is best if you have your wallet where you have full control.They said the reason for closing is because US Bittrex is bankrupt.I hope this helps, and makes members aware to transfer their funds out of Bittrex.Here is the link to the news.https://www.coindesk.com/business/2023/11/21/crypto-exchange-bittrex-global-to-shut-down/https://bittrexglobal.com/#:~:text=Bittrex%20was%20founded%20in%202014,our%20customers%20can%20count%20on.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: At least they gave a pre information before planning to shut down. This is more reasons why it's not advisable to leave your funds on centralized exchanges as they can wake up one morning and decide they are shutting operations. Although for Bittrex's case, they files for bankruptcy in May after being sued by the SEC for operating a national securities exchange without seeking their approval. From the looks of this news, it seems the CEO, Oliver Linch lost the battle after much huff about dealing with the charges vigorously. I'm wondering if it's the $24m settlement given to the SEC that crumbled the company.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: This is a serious issue and another indication that CEX might not be enjoying the popularity they once enjoyed among crypto users in the wake of increasing need for privacy. It could also be the reason mixers are flourishing which is in line with the reason for the creation of Bitcoin. Bittrex is known for having one of the most rigorous KYC process, maybe people just got fed up with such herculean process when there are better alternatives. For instance, to complete KYC in Binance and Kucoin, a Nigeria just need his Bank Verification Number (BVN) and the KYC process will be completed in minutes. Unlike Bittrex where a valid ID and proof of address as well as funds are mandatory. I just hope this does not have negative impact on the entire cryptocurrency market.

comments.author: Amphenomenon
comments.body: CEX and bankruptcy are together forever at least this is still better than the FTX last year where customers were not given a chance to make withdrawal and when they were given it was not a normal rate, those who fail to see this early will more likely be victimised again, good non-custodial wallet like bluewallet and Electrum are still the best.Ps, if you are using Trustwallet don't ever think you are safe, go for a better wallet please.

comments.body: I haven't kept up with Bittrex for several years. This is because of some exchange regulations that disappointed me. Almost 3 years I have been with Bittrex but finally I decided to leave because of a KYC case. This has never happened before and my friend was not asked for this condition, they can still transact. I have to create a passport for activities on Exchange as KYC compliance. Since then I was disappointed, I had to make a passport. After KYC fulfillment I finally quit Bittrex.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: I believe they should have taken some measures to inform their clients to start transferring their funds to their own personal wallets for their own safety, because that is what is available whenever such a thing wants to take place. Sometimes what I believe causes exchanges and casinos to shut down is not really about liquidity but just some basic principles they ignore, which are sometimes as vital or important as the case may be. For instance, when it comes to awareness, publicity is very important, and as such, when it is noticed that the traffic is beginning to reduce, what it is showing is that such an organization would need to strengthen or take a step to do an advertisement or a promotional campaign to revive and make known their presence to be in existence, but they fail to look in that direction but rather decide to shut down. But however, it is good they returned assets belonging to their customers, and that would speak for them whenever they decide or plan a return.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Odohu on November 21, 2023, 11:54:51 AMThis is a serious issue and another indication that CEX might not be enjoying the popularity they once enjoyed among crypto users in the wake of increasing need for privacy. It could also be the reason mixers are flourishing which is in line with the reason for the creation of Bitcoin. Increased crypto awareness is now making people know the importance of holding their keys but this is the case of strict regulation by the US SEC. Most exchanges make the majority of profit from the US market. Without the US market, many of them will become bankrupt and I think this was the case of Bittrex Global after its US arm was forced out of the US crypto market. Quote from: 348Judah on November 21, 2023, 02:09:52 PMThis same thing will come upon any other exchange soon, tge best is to stay away from tgem and hold your coins with you by using a non custodial wallet, bankruptcy is very common nowadays with centralized institutions, they easily get financial problems by any chance. Exchanges that want to operate in the US will have to comply with the regulatory laws. I think they will be fine if they allow the SEC to have access to all their transactions. Maybe in future will might have exchanges that will operate like commercial banks with the government having total control over them. Bittrex Global has given customers till December 4 to withdraw all their funds, this is the beauty of the winding up.
